Cultural Values: Humans have different cultural values and beliefs, which can differ drastically from those of other intelligent beings. How will we handle different perspectives and value systems when communicating with alien life?

Technological Barriers: Even if we develop a basic communication system, how will we effectively translate our messages and ideas into something that aliens can understand, especially since their culture and technology may be vastly different from ours?
Perception of Earth: How do aliens perceive Earth and humans? How will their existing beliefs and knowledge affect the way they interpret and respond to our communications?
Legal Issues: If we succeed in establishing communication with alien life, there may be legal implications for international relations and national security.
Security Threats: Can we guarantee that communication with other intelligent beings won't create security risks to the world at large?
